replies.body:
If you wish to talk to your friend, use the /whisper or /reply functions.

If you didn't wish to say hate speech to everyone on your team, you shouldn't have used game chat. Hate speech has no place in a game with strangers.

> If you didn't wish to say hate speech to everyone on your team, you shouldn't have used game chat. Hate speech has no place in a game with strangers.

Can i ask what is considered hate speech here?

saying the word "F**k"?

i read this over 3 times and i cant pinpoint direct hate speech, hes not using racial slurs, hes not using derogatory names, hes just saying f**k a lot...

is that really permabannable?

why isnt chat just disabled if saying the word f**k multiple times is permabannable?

> shoe6535: undeafen me %%%
>
> shoe6535: %%%

I didn't know "fuck" was a three letter word. Or that the boards censored it with percent signs.

Because those aren't instances of the word "fuck". "fuck" isn't hate speech. Those words still almost certainly start with an F, but they don't end with "uck".

It's hate speech, because those three letter words are homophobic slurs.

And the system is supposed to know that how?

Hate speech has no place in League and is definitely something you will be banned for. If you're going to use hate speech while talking to a friend, use /w (insert summoner name), do not put it in team chat. The moment you put it in team chat, you subject your other teammates to that kind of speech, and they have every right to report you for it.

Bans are actually done manually, not automated. The system just flags them for manual review.

100% deserved, though.
Actually the automated system does ban people without any manual review from a human. Manual reviews can lead to a ban but they are not necessary.
another example of shameless defending of riot {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I am sorry if stating facts offends you.

Reality is not subjective.

Even the people that don't find what you wrote offensive, if they've ever been punished for speaking like that, it gives them a sense of satisfaction reporting a random stranger for it, knowing that they will get punished for it. 

You always have to be on the lookout for potential immaturity.

also can i mention that Riot has a perfectly functional chat filter system and muting system, and if people don't want to be exposed to this "hate speech" they can use chat filter or mute the "offender" but people can int or actually be toxic or troll and hurt others but not use a few key words and get away with it.
